page.title: 07TRANSPORT Essex/Cambs Border
page.content: Almost all households have cars, including the over 60's. At least 50% have more than one vehicle to take them to their employment and shops. A bus travels to and from Cambridge each day. There is a market day bus to Saffron Walden and Bishops Stortford. 25% of residents have used this service. A school bus is provided for children. Most homes own bikes - some are used for work. Some walk. Commuters traveling to London have good road and rail links. Main rail lines to Liverpool Street and Kings Cross - London. M11 Motorway access within 6 miles. This gives access to Stansted Airport and M25 Motorway - 2 hours to Dover - main cross-channel port.
